A capon is a rooster that has been castrated before reaching sexual maturity. The reason a rooster is made into a capon has mostly to do with the quality of the meat. But also, a capon is less aggressive than a rooster and is easier to handle. The difference between capon meat and rooster meat is due to the absence of sexual hormones. The process of making a rooster into a capon is called caponization. A capon is usually castrated at around 8 weeks of age or earlier.
